lexUnit.name: varied.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: incorporating a number of different types or elements; showing variation or variety.

sentence.text: A reward ` menu " is simply a list of interchangeable rewards which can be used to provide a varied diet to maintain interest .
Look after yourself by eating a balanced and varied diet of protein , dairy products and fresh fruit and vegetables , getting enough rest and cutting out the things that can harm your baby .
The restaurant offers a varied Italian menu , and the owner Signor Valastro provides a warm welcome .

This varied selection of international work gives an insight into the policies of cultural decentralisation in France whereby each region has a responsibility to create and make available a collection of contemporary work .
It is important , too , that a particular class group or year group should enjoy varied experiences on different visits .
This is a very simple example ; it is easy to conceive of extremely varied and complex patterns of linkage appearing in various contexts .
The Great Forest is an ancient , vast and very varied woodland .
The delays are very varied and multiple repeats stay true to the original tone , as do the chorus and pitch-shifted sounds .
The Metropolitan 's 33,000 textiles constitute one of the largest and most varied collections in the world .
It should be clear from our list of terms above that there is quite a pronounced divide between ectotherms and endotherms , with the latter having a more varied range of thermoregulatory techniques .
And in this varied picture there were even some share-croppers still to be found , though everywhere they were dwindling in importance .
Many and varied uses for shrub roses
Throughout the year , the city hosts a varied programme of major festivals .
Academic reactions to Lord Templeman 's judgment were many and varied .
There are many and varied versions of the link-leger designed to combat the same problem .
And the goals of this policy are many and varied .
He had had a varied and an outstanding career .
However , despite a varied programme there has been great difficulty in gathering support for the other functions and indeed the last one had to be cancelled .
The many and varied attempts by governments both to take over foreign assets and to set up new state-owned businesses , have seldom been successful .
Breakfast is served on the garden terrace , and the restaurant offers varied cuisine .
Over a period of time she was seen by a number of psychotherapists and psychologists who adopted differing approaches to her varied problems .
The contract provided by the vast acres of farm land , the small market towns , the noble city of York , National Parks and seaside resorts , could hardly be more varied .
to lovers of the sea it is a great treat , and affords scope for varied tastes .
The wildlife is varied , beautiful -- and some of it is likely to arrive on your plate .
